intro: Sunipia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored sunipia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctively variegated leaves, which display shades of green and white. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Sunipia bicolor thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
